intro: Corysanthes puberula, commonly known as the hairy corysanthes, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring hairy foliage that gives it its common name. Corysanthes puberula is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and horticultural displays.
